Key Match Events: Cade Cunningham recorded his first triple-double of the regular season (17 points, 11 rebounds, 11 assists).
Pre-Game Insights: The Pistons secured their first winning streak of the season.
The Pistons were led by a balanced offensive attack.
Jaden Ivey led the charge with 26 points, and six players finished in double figures.
Cade Cunningham was among the other notable performers, notching his first triple-double of the regular season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Pistons have an off day Tuesday before resuming action Wednesday against the Charlotte Hornets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pistons were able to take down the Lakers by a final score of 115-103.
Anthony Davis notched a game-high 37 points, and LeBron James finished with 20 points and 11 assists.
Bench scoring would be a key factor in this matchup, as the Lakers were only able to produce 10 points from their second unit.
Meanwhile, the Pistons got 27 points from the four players J.B. Bickerstaff brought off the bench.
